it.unifi.rc.httpserver.m5765968.Test

Class MyHTTPHandlerHost1_0Test

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.unifi.rc.httpserver.m5765968.Test.MyHTTPHandlerHost1_0Test

  • public class MyHTTPHandlerHost1_0Test
extends java.lang.Object
    This class tests the processing of an HostHTTP/1.0 request.
    Author:
    Mattia D'Autilia

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MyHTTPHandlerHost1_0Test() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void controlHost()
      Checks the parameters of the two replies.
      void createfile()
      Creates the path of the files and for each calls the method createFile() to create them.
      void newReplyHost()
      Reads a replyHost from a basic string and recall the method to create the reply object.
      void newRequestHost()
      Reads a requestHost from a basic string and recall the method to create the requested object.
      void newRequestNoHost()
      Reads a requestNoHost from a basic string and recall the method to create the requested object.
      void setInputStreamReply(byte[] buf)
      Creates a object Reply from a basic string contained in the buffer in the form of bytes.
      void setInputStreamRequest(byte[] buf)
      Create a object Request from a basic string contained in the buffer in the form of bytes.
      void setUp()
      Creates an HTTPFactory object for general object management, calls the method setfile(), for creating files to test requests, and then creates an HostHTTPHandler1_0 to handle requests.
      void testHost()
      Creates a requested object, a response(waiting) object, and a response object on the request, by calling the methods(newRequestHost(), newReplyHost(), handle(request)), and then tests the value of the two response objects with the control() method.
      void testNoHost()
      Creates a requested object and a response object on the request, by calling the methods(newRequestHost(), handle(request)), and then test the value of the response object with the null value.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
